verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to Jonath elem rehokim. A Psalm of David. Michtam; when the Philistines took him in Gath. Be mercifu <S%H2603><s%> unto me <S%H430><s%>, O God; For man <S%H582><s%> would swallow me up <S%H7602><s%>: All the day <S%H3117><s%> long he fighting <S%H3898><s%> oppresseth me <S%H3905><s%>.
Mine enemies <S%H8324><s%> would swallow <S%H7602><s%> me up all the day <S%H3117><s%> long <S%H4791><s%>; For they are many <S%H7227><s%> that fight proudly against me <S%H3898><s%>.
What time <S%H3117><s%> I am afraid <S%H3372><s%>, I will put my trust in thee <S%H982><s%>.

In God <S%H430><s%> (I will praise <S%H1984><s%> his word <S%H1697><s%>), In God <S%H430><s%> have I put my trust <S%H982><s%>, I will not be afraid <S%H3372><s%>; What can flesh <S%H1320><s%> do unto me <S%H6213><s%>?
All the day <S%H3117><s%> long they wrest <S%H6087><s%> my words <S%H1697><s%>: All their thoughts <S%H4284><s%> are against me for evil <S%H7451><s%>.
They gather themselves together <S%H1481><s%>, they hide <S%H6845><s%> themselves <S%H8104><s%>, They mark my steps <S%H6119><s%>, Even as they have waited <S%H6960><s%> for my soul <S%H5315><s%>.
Shall they escape <S%H6405><s%> by iniquity <S%H205><s%>? In anger <S%H639><s%> cast down <S%H3381><s%> the peoples <S%H5971><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>.
Thou numberest <S%H5608><s%> my wanderings <S%H5112><s%>: Put <S%H7760><s%> thou my tears <S%H1832><s%> into thy bottle <S%H4997><s%>; Are they not in thy book <S%H5612><s%>?
Then shall mine enemies <S%H341><s%> turn <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H268><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> that I call <S%H7121><s%>: This I know <S%H3045><s%>, that God is for me <S%H430><s%>.
In God <S%H430><s%> (I will praise <S%H1984><s%> his word <S%H1697><s%>), In Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> (I will praise <S%H1984><s%> his word <S%H1697><s%>),
In God <S%H430><s%> have I put my trust <S%H982><s%>, I will not be afraid <S%H3372><s%>; What can man <S%H120><s%> do unto me <S%H6213><s%>?
Thy vows <S%H5088><s%> are upon me <S%H430><s%>, O God: I will render <S%H7999><s%> thank-offerings <S%H8426><s%> unto thee.

For thou hast delivered <S%H5337><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from death <S%H4194><s%>: Hast thou not delivered my feet <S%H7272><s%> from falling <S%H1762><s%>, That I may walk <S%H1980><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> God <S%H430><s%> In the light <S%H216><s%> of the living <S%H2416><s%>?
